name: France
takeaway: The Media Domain is likey to see a significant expansion of PRC influence versus the China Index 2022, with BMF TV a notable vector for this in France. CGTN French and French-speaking influencers are observed to echo PRC propaganda, with repercussions across the Francophone world.
Academia remains a target of significant influence activities and has yet to erect adequate safeguards, presenting a difficult environment for would-be-critical voices.

In the Society Domain, evidence includes a French Senate-commissioned report showing that infiltration of the Chinese diaspora in France is a growing concern, though Society remains the least influenced Domain in the "Ideology" cluster, which also includes Academia and Media.

The PRC’s lack of influence in the Economy Domain remains remarkable, and contrasts with that observed in Germany, though there is some Technology Domain evidence of PRC firms making inroads into France’s telecoms sector.

There is only very limited influence in the Law Enforcement, Military and Foreign Policy Domains, which make up the “Rulemaking” cluster, though France does support the PRC’s position that Taiwan is a part of its territory.
description-1: In 2023, France had a GDP per capita of US$44,461 and a total population of 66.38 million people.
description-2: France established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1964. France was ranked 21st in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 89/100.

Media.evidence: The situation is more of very strong influence , mostly via the Nouvelles d’Europe (欧洲时报), France's oldest sinophone media, which now belongs to a company contorled by the United Front

Media.evidence: The main one is CGTN French which of course aims mostly francophone Africa but is also availble in France and does cover France; China Radio International also broadc sts in French, again mostly for Africa,; and there is a print magazine that relays Beijing's messages to French audiences

Media.evidence: Maxime Vivas is the most notorious one and has support from a publisher Les routes de la soie, run by  Sonia Bressler who acts as a go-between with the CCP . Vivas has published several books and has a considerable following and just publshed a book alleging Reporters without Borders (RSF) is an agent of the CIA

Foreign Policy.evidence: The French Senate has one that is very active. There is also a French-Cambodian-Chinese former MP (who lsot in 2022) Buon Tan who acts as a relay between China and France to support pro-Beijing narratives and whose brother owns pro-Beijign media.
